TypeSignature.Value: public class FlowDocumentScrollViewer : System.Windows.Controls.Control, IServiceProvider, System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild
.class public auto ansi FlowDocumentScrollViewer extends System.Windows.Controls.Control implements class System.IServiceProvider, class System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild

Docs.summary: Provides a control for viewing flow content in a continuous scrolling mode.

remarks.format:
## Remarks FlowDocumentScrollViewer shows content in continuous scrolling mode. A similar control, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer>, shows content in page-at-a-time viewing mode. Both <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> and FlowDocumentScrollViewer are fixed to a particular viewing mode. On the other hand, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReader> includes features that enable the user to dynamically choose between various viewing modes (as provided by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReaderViewingMode> enumeration), at the cost of being heavier weight than <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> or FlowDocumentScrollViewer.
The following figure shows a FlowDocumentScrollViewer control with its default [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)].
![Screenshot: Basic FlowDocumentScrollViewer](~/add/media/flowdocscrollviewer-main.png "Screenshot: Basic FlowDocumentScrollViewer")
By default, a vertical scrollbar is always shown, and a horizontal scrollbar becomes visible if needed. The default [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] for FlowDocumentScrollViewer does not include a toolbar; however, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.IsToolBarVisible%2A> property can be used to enable a built-in toolbar.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument> is the only allowable child element for a FlowDocumentScrollViewer. A FlowDocumentScrollViewer element may host no more than one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument>.
## Examples The following example defines the FlowDocumentScrollViewer pictured in the figure above.
[!code-xml[FloaterFigureSnippets#_FlowDocumentScrollViewerXAML](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/FloaterFigureSnippets/Window1.xaml#_flowdocumentscrollviewerxaml)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void DecreaseZoom() cil managed

Docs.summary: Executes the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.DecreaseZoom%2A> routed command.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The DecreaseZoom method decreases the current <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom%2A> level by the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.ZoomIncrement%2A> property.
Calling this method has no effect if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.CanDecreaseZoom%2A> property returns `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Find() cil managed

Docs.summary: Toggles the **Find** dialog.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, Ctrl+F provides a keyboard shortcut for toggling the **Find** dialog. The following figure shows the **Find** dialog on a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> with default UI.
![Screenshot: FlowDocumentScrollViewer find dialog](~/add/media/flowdocscrollviewer-find.png "Screenshot: FlowDocumentScrollViewer find dialog")
The default **Find** dialog includes a field for entering search text, as well as buttons for **Find Next**, **Find Previous**, and **Options**. The following **Find** options are provided by default:
- Match whole word only
- Match case
- Match diacritic
- Match kashida
- Match alef hamza

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnContextMenuOpening(class System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.summary: Invoked whenever an unhandled routed event reaches this class in its route. Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method has no default implementation. You should still call the base implementation in case an intermediate class in the inheritance has implemented this method.
The purpose of this method is somewhat similar to [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On* methods: it provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes with a class handler instead of an instance handler. In this case the matching event is a routed event. The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because the routed event may have been raised by a child element, not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers, so your implementation will need to take the event arguments' source properties into account (and should not try to re-raise the event in most cases). Subclasses of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> could choose to call private class handler methods when the event is received along the route. One potential scenario is to take the arguments of the event and deliberately mark the event as handled.

Docs.summary: Invokes a standard **Print** dialog which can be used to print the contents of the and configure printing preferences.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] does not provide a **Print** button.
The following figure shows an example of a standard **Print** dialog. Note that the specific appearance of the **Print** dialog may vary depending on the hosting computer's configuration.
![Screenshot: Print dialog box](~/add/media/flowdocrdr-print.png "Screenshot: Print dialog box")

Docs.summary: Gets the selected content of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Selection is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example shows how to get the text that a user has selected in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer>.
[!code-xml[FlowDocSelection#3](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/FlowDocSelection/Window2.xaml#3)] [!code-cs[FlowDocSelection#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/FlowDocSelection/Window2.xaml.cs#4)] [!code-vb[FlowDocSelection#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/FlowDocSelection/Window2.xaml.vb#4)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the brush that highlights the selected text.
Docs.value: A brush that highlights the selected text.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can specify the brush that highlights selected text in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> by setting the SelectionBrush and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionOpacity%2A> properties.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer>, sets the SelectionBrush property to pink, and sets the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionOpacity%2A> property to 0.7.
[!code-xml[FlowDocScrollVwSelBrushSnippet#SelectionBrush](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/fdsvselectionbrushsnippet/window1.xaml#selectionbrush)] [!code-xml[FlowDocScrollVwSelBrushSnippet#SelectionBrush](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/p-system.windows.control_156_1.xaml)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty SelectionBrushProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush%2A> dependency property.
Gets or sets the opacity of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush%2A>.
Docs.value: The opacity of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush%2A>. The default is 0.4.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you set the SelectionOpacity to 0, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush%2A> is transparent and is not visible. If you set the SelectionOpacity to 1.0, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush%2A> is opaque and the selected text is not visible.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer>, sets the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush%2A> property to pink, and sets the SelectionOpacity property to 0.7.
[!code-xml[FlowDocScrollVwSelBrushSnippet#SelectionBrush](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/fdsvselectionbrushsnippet/window1.xaml#selectionbrush)] [!code-xml[FlowDocScrollVwSelBrushSnippet#SelectionBrush](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/p-system.windows.control_129_1.xaml)]
